conclusion: The EMF induced in a coil is given by Faraday's Law: EMF = -m dPhi/dt, where m is the number of turns and Phi is the magnetic flux.
The magnetic flux Phi varies sinusoidally with time t as shown in Figure (Z).
The general form of sinusoidal variation of magnetic flux is Phi(t) = Phi_max sin(omega t), where Phi_max is the maximum magnetic flux and omega is the angular frequency.
The period T of the sinusoidal variation is approximately 6.28 x 10^-2 seconds, thus omega = 2pi/T = 100pi rad/s.
The rate of change of magnetic flux dPhi/dt is Phi_max omega cos(omega t), and the maximum value occurs when cos(omega t) = 1, giving (dPhi/dt)_max = Phi_max omega.
The maximum EMF is calculated as EMF_max = m Phi_max omega.
From the graph, Phi_max = 2.0 x 10^-2 Wb.
Substituting the known values, EMF_max = 100 x 2.0 x 10^-2 x 100pi = 628 V.
The maximum value of the electromotive force generated by the alternating current generator is 628 V.
